The study conducted by Alia Crum at Stanford University revealed how beliefs about physical activity can influence weight loss and overall health.
Hotel service workers were divided into two groups.
One group was simply informed that their daily activities already met the standards for recommended physical activity in the US.
The other group received detailed information about how their daily movements could benefit their cardiovascular health and aid in weight loss.
Researchers observed remarkable results over the course of several weeks.
The group was educated about the benefits of movement.
The group experienced more significant weight loss.
The group experienced improvements in body fat percentage.
The group experienced positive changes in their waist-to-hip ratio.
